title: 1. Introduction
text:
Overview of the SRS document and its intended audience.

  • 1.1 Purpose: Describe the purpose of the SRS and intended readers.
  • 1.2 Scope: Outline the product to be developed, its features.
  • 1.3 Definitions, Acronyms, and Abbreviations: Define key terms.
  • 1.4 References: List referenced documents.
  • 1.5 Overview: Describe what the rest of the document contains.

title: 2. Overall Description
text:
General description of the product and its environment.

  • 2.1 Product Perspective: How this product fits within related systems.
  • 2.2 Product Functions: High-level summary of capabilities.
  • 2.3 User Characteristics: Expected users and expertise.
  • 2.4 Constraints: Hardware, software, regulatory restrictions.
  • 2.5 Assumptions and Dependencies: External factors and assumptions.

title: 3. Specific Requirements
text:
Detailed, precise requirements of the system.

  • 3.1 Functional Requirements: Detailed descriptions of each function.
  • 3.2 External Interface Requirements: Interaction with other systems and users.
  • 3.3 Performance Requirements: Speed, accuracy, throughput.
  • 3.4 Design Constraints: Limitations on design.
  • 3.5 Quality Attributes: Reliability, security, maintainability.

title: 4. Other Requirements
text: Additional requirements such as legal, safety, security, or cultural considerations.

title: Example: Functional Requirement Syntax
text:
3.1.1 Feature Name

Description: What this feature does.

Inputs: Describe input data.

Outputs: Describe output data.

Preconditions: Conditions before execution.

Postconditions: Conditions after execution.
